qas.question: What was a major issue with CD-4 technology?

answers.text: no cutting heads were available that could handle the HF information

qas.question: How widespread was the success of CD-4 format?

answers.text: even less successful than the two matrixed formats

qas.question: What format was less successful than quadraphonic?
What were potential benefits of the CD-4 format?

context: A different format, <a2_0>CD-4<a2_0/> (not to be confused with compact disc), by <a4_0>RCA<a4_0/>, encoded the front-rear difference information on an ultrasonic carrier, which required a special wideband cartridge to capture it on carefully calibrated pickup arm/turntable combinations. CD-4 was <a1_0>even less successful than the two matrixed formats<a1_0/>. (A further problem was that <a0_0>no cutting heads were available that could handle the HF information<a0_0/>. That was remedied by cutting at half the speed. Later, the special half-speed cutting heads and equalization techniques were employed to get a wider frequency response in stereo with <a3_0>reduced distortion and greater headroom<a3_0/>.)
